text: Investigate the Cleaner and search for clues (0/3)

title: Mission Description
content: Cipher brought Kephale's Coreflame to Styxia for safeguarding, then single-handedly fended off the Cleaners who sought to seize it. Yet the threat goes beyond the Council's assassins, for at the same moment, the Flame Reaver's figure has settled upon the nether shore.

text: Thousands of years ago, in the sleeping quarters of Kephale's priests...

speaker: Cipher
line: Uhh...

speaker: Cipher
line: Seriously, where did they hide that thing...

speaker: Cipher
line: Trash, just trash... What is this? Never mind. I'll take it anyway...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Ah, I finally found it!

speaker: Cipher
line: It must be this! The Gem of All Worlds that the Chaplain secretly stashed away, said to be a fragment peeled from the Dawn Device...

speaker: Cipher
line: Sniff... sniff...

speaker: Cipher
line: Heh, I can already catch the sweet scent of treasure seeping from this little box. So much for the Chaplain's devotion to faith — it turns out he's just been padding his secret stash...

speaker: Cipher
line: I've been lurking in the Priestly Court for over half a year just for this little trinket! Day after day, listening to those stiff priest apprentices drone on with their prayers. I thought I was going to lose my mind...

speaker: Cipher
line: Good thing persistence pays off, heh...

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: Atti... Atticus... is that you?

speaker: Cipher
line: (Atticus? That name rings a bell... Oh, he's the apprentice the Chaplain favors most, the one everyone expects to be the next Chaplain...?)

speaker: Cipher
line: (Not saying anything would feel awkward... maybe I can hold it together with Zagreus 's ability for now?)

speaker: Cipher
line: (Now... I am Atticus. )

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: Atti...cus? Why aren't you... responding...?

speaker: Cipher
line: Old... ahem, Chaplain, it's me. I'm here to assist you with your medicine.

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: Ah... thank you. Without your care, I would've long been claimed by Thanatos and carried to the River of Souls...

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh... no need to thank me, master. It's my duty to care for you while you recover.

speaker: Cipher
line: (This old man is way sicker than I thought... Looks like the priests are deliberately hiding how bad it really is.)

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: Atticus... I can feel my life slipping away, fading faster with every moment. I don't know when eternal sleep will claim me...

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: There's one last thing I must tell you...

speaker: Cipher
line: (One last thing? Wait... is he hiding more treasures? Maybe a "Coin of Whimsy"!? Today might just be my lucky day!)

speaker: Cipher
line: (Ahem, calm down, Cifera... Just breathe.)

speaker: Cipher
line: Stay strong, Chaplain. Keep your spirits up and don't lose hope.

speaker: Cipher
line: If there's anything important you need to say... I'm all ears.

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: Ah... it's so disgraceful that it fills me with shame. Yet, I must speak... for it concerns the fate of our holy city below my feet.

speaker: Cipher
line: (What? The fate of the city's people? Is it that serious? I must find out more...)

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: The omniscient sky father, Kephale , before they fell silent... I heard their last words at Dawncloud...

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: It announced: The prophecy has arrived, my mission has concluded, and I shall return to silence...

speaker: Cipher
line: (Oh, the Prophecy of Genesis. The Titan turned to stone... Heard it a thousand times. Old news. What else you got?)

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: The eternal night is looming, but over the next three hundred years, the Dawn Device will safeguard the holy city, poised for the children of humanity to create miracles...

speaker: Cipher
line: (Mmhmm, the Dawn Device, the miracle of Genesis, the usual clichés...)

speaker: Cipher
line: (Wait, did he just say... "the next three hundred years" ?)

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: I... have concealed the deadline the sky father set for everyone...

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: I lacked the courage to carve the countdown to the city's new dawn into the hearts of its people...

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: Atticus, you... are a hundred times more courageous than I am. Can you accomplish... what I could not?

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: Will you share this harsh truth... with all the citizens of Okhema?

speaker: Dying Chaplain
line: Atticus...?

speaker: Cipher
line: Rest easy, master. I will shoulder this heavy burden for you... I'll address the fallout of your indecision.

speaker: Cipher
line: Is that right, Seamstress? "Everyone in this world is unique in their own way..."

speaker: Cipher
line: My moment to be a hero... has finally arrived.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...And that was my stint as a priest at Dawncloud. Sure, the story's been slightly embellished, but every word of it is true.

speaker: Cipher
line: These are secrets that must remain undisclosed. I've never shared them with anyone, not even Bartholos.

speaker: Cipher
line: You should feel incredibly honored to be the first to hear this.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Unfortunately, you can't clap or comment right now.

speaker: Cipher
line: But that's beside the point! Getting to spill the secret I've been holding in for a thousand years feels amazing right now.

speaker: Cipher
line: Honestly, I'm surprised at your persistence...

speaker: Cipher
line: I merely staged a slip-up for you to witness the switch of the Coreflame... Who'd have thought you'd follow me all the way to the Nethershore?

speaker: Cipher
line: That Deliverer kid was spot-on. You rejects, shunned by the Okhemans, have no choice but to keep moving down this dark path...

speaker: Cipher
line: One, two, three, four... wait...

speaker: Cipher
line: What's going on? Your leader Caenis isn't here? Could she be plotting something else?

speaker: Cipher
line: Ah, such a hassle... Well, for everyone's safety, I might as well check if you're carrying anything suspicious.

text: (Investigate the Cleaner in front)

speaker: Cipher
line: Let me take a look at what's hidden under that mask —

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmm... your face looks innocent enough. Who would've guessed that such a pretty face would hide a heart full of darkness?

speaker: Cipher
line: Appearances can be deceiving. It's a fool's game to judge someone's character just by their looks.

speaker: Cipher
line: It's amazing what the seamstress can do with her divine authority. She sees right through people with that golden thread of hers, beyond whatever facade they put up.

speaker: Cipher
line: As for using divine powers... I'm no slouch myself!

text: (Investigate the Cleaner on the left)

speaker: Cipher
line: Who came up with this uniform? It's got more pockets than it needs. Nobody wears this style anymore, do they?

speaker: Cipher
line: Back in the days when I was doing honest work for the Goldweaver, I saw my fair share of these...

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh, what do we have here?

text: The Cleaner's Rendezvous Note
After the Usurper 's death, the Phyton mobilized many refugees to join the garrison and restructured the city 's defenses. The updated schedule is as follows:
Guard shifts at the Marmoreal Market have increased in frequency — from Action Hour to Curtain-Fall Hour, all patrols along the Path of Parting will begin one quint earlier.
Take careful note of these changes to avoid unnecessary complications.
The note appears to have been smoothed flat then curled again, suggesting it was once rolled inside a secret message cylinder.
███████ , high priest of the Flame-Chasers.
A middle-aged ███ with gray hair, stooped posture, and a burn scar on the right side of the neck. Visits the chanting hall alone to pray during Entry Hour's first quint █████ .
An exposed iron nail will be placed on the stair railing. █████████ , an accident might █████ silence him permanently.
Dark, crusted bloodstains have obscured the text, and the names have been deliberately smeared away by bloody fingers.
Phyton and the Maiden have been frequently visiting the Twilight Courtyard lately to meet with healers.
In their conversations, they've mentioned the Skyfolk and the Daythunder Knight 's past affairs. The day to reclaim Aquila 's Coreflame appears to be imminent —
A thousand-year-old grudge will be settled then. Make preparations, for that moment draws near.
...written on the inner side of a clean bandage, emitting a dry, herbal fragrance.

speaker: Cipher
line: ...A paper note? Talk about old school...

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh, right... once the seamstress's powers diminished, the World Wound Web slowed drastically, from five threads to just two...

speaker: Cipher
line: Looks like I was too quick to judge — physical note-passing still outpaces the reduced threads.

text: (Investigate the Cleaner on the right)

speaker: Cipher
line: This dagger's got a nice look to it. Let's see it...

speaker: Cipher
line: Wow, it's crafted from Kremnoan steel — these people are well-equipped.

speaker: Cipher
line: By any standard, you all are quite capable. Had you not strayed, you could have been guarding Okhema, securing a stable income.

speaker: Cipher
line: Such a pity... In your next life, remember to choose a safer path, and stay away from dangerous jobs like this.

speaker: Cipher
line: Hmm... no trace of Caenis. Is she hiding too well, or has she given up?

speaker: Cipher
line: Well, I've done everything I could. Now it's in the hands of the Deliverer and his crew...

speaker: Cipher
line: Huh!? What was that —

speaker: Cipher
line: The noise came from above, could it be...

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha... it looks like they pulled it off.

speaker: Cipher
line: The Deliverer's impressive, no doubt, but some of the credit should go to that Gray Mystery from beyond the sky.

speaker: Cipher
line: I've crossed paths with them before. They're a little quirky, but their power? Absolutely terrifying.

speaker: Cipher
line: With the Coreflame of Aquila taken...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...the Flame-Chase Journey is down to its final threat.

speaker: Cipher
line: Ah... they're already here. Barely gave me a moment to catch my breath.

speaker: Cipher
line: Alright then... Guess it's my turn to see what you've got!

text: Meet the Uninvited Guest

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh! You made it? I've been waiting for you!

speaker: Cipher
line: Black-clad swordmaster, the Flame Reaver, whatever your name is —

speaker: Cipher
line: Look at you, sniffing around like a starving hyena... chasing the scent of the Coreflames!

speaker: Cipher
line: What's wrong? Cat got your tongue? Or maybe you're just too dense to understand plain speech?

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Throne of Worlds ... Coreflame...

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Must... take back...

speaker: Cipher
line: You sad little thing, I've got you all figured out!

speaker: Cipher
line: Let me guess — you've been eyeing these last two Coreflames all along, huh?

speaker: Cipher
line: No wings, no allies... what a pity. Even with Aquila's Coreflame sitting idly in the sky, you're helpless to reach it.

speaker: Cipher
line: All you can do is sit and wait for the Chrysos Heirs to bring it down, then swoop in like a brute to snatch it for yourself, isn't that so?

speaker: Cipher
line: Hah! Struck a nerve, have I? I've seen you lingering on a cliff more than once, staring hopelessly at the sky. Pathetic.

speaker: Cipher
line: But hey, I'm feeling generous today — I've got a surprise just for you.

speaker: Cipher
line: ... That's right! I have Kephale's Coreflame.

speaker: Cipher
line: But if you think you can snatch it from my claws...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...you'll have to catch me!

text: Escape the Flame Reaver's pursuit

speaker: Cipher
line: Fun fact! Dolos cats aren't just quick on their feet...

speaker: Cipher
line: They've got the stamina to match!

speaker: Cipher
line: Ow! How... how did you get ahead of me!?

speaker: Cipher
line: Whoa, whoa, whoa! Don't swing that thing — easy there!

speaker: Cipher
line: You're after Kephale's Coreflame, aren't you? Fine, take it! The Deliverer made me steal it! It's no use to me anyway!

speaker: Cipher
line: Look, uh... since we've got the same taste in fashion — all black and sleek — how about you spare this poor cat's life?

speaker: Cipher
line: That's the spirit! You get the Coreflame, and I get to keep breathing — everyone wins!

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Core... flame...

speaker: Cipher
line: Haha! You really are a brainless mutt, aren't you?

speaker: Cipher
line: Woof, woof! Come on. Come on, you're not gonna let a little setback like a lost bone stop you, are you?

speaker: Cipher
line: (...Well, look at that. They actually caught up with me. No one's ever managed that before...)

speaker: Cipher
line: It's been a while since I've had a chase this good. Don't quit on me now — I'm just getting into the groove!

text: Ride the platform to higher ground

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Cre... ation...

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Must...

speaker: Cipher
line: You sure stumble over your words, but you've got some speed on you!

speaker: Cipher
line: I'm going to speed up. Don't get left behind!

text: (Ascend using the platform)

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha, just in time to take a break.

speaker: Cipher
line: Don't tell me that they might already be waiting for me upstairs...

speaker: Cipher
line: What? Still not here? Well, that's disappointing.

speaker: Cipher
line: Oh well, I guess I'll just...

speaker: "Ciphainon"
line: ...wait around a little longer for you!

speaker: "Ciphainon"
line: Styxia, you're stunning... Oh? Look who it is — the Flame Reaver!

speaker: "Ciphainon"
line: First time — wait, no, not the first time meeting you. I'm the great hero of Okhema, the Deliverer of Amphoreus!

speaker: "Ciphainon"
line: They say I'm destined to return Kephale's Coreflame and carry the weight of a new world on my shoulders...

speaker: "Ciphainon"
line: But hey, fairness is my thing — fairness, fairness, and *Dolos profanity* fairness! You want the Coreflame? Come and get it! But only if you can beat me fair and square!

speaker: "Ciphainon"
line: Ugh, boring... I was hoping you'd at least humor me for a little while.

speaker: Cipher
line: Stupid mutt. Fooled by the same trick twice...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Bye-bye, "Flame Reaver"!

speaker: Cipher
line: Sigh... Not as fun as I'd hoped. I guess a brainless brute isn't much fun when it comes to mind games.

speaker: Cipher
line: (I... seriously can't shake them off, huh... This is borderline impossible)

speaker: Cipher
line: (They're not going to back off anytime soon... Well then...)

speaker: Cipher
line: (...Guess I'll just have to lead it somewhere higher.)

text: Go to a high ground and lure the Flame Reaver over
(Approach the elevator, optional)

speaker: Cipher
line: The plan can't fall apart... lead that mutt up high!

text: Borrow the Rune of Recollection

speaker: Aglaea
line: Cifera... Do you still plan to go to Dawncloud?

speaker: Cifera
line: Hmm, I've made up my mind. Don't think about stopping me, Seamstress.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Is it for the Gem of All Worlds?

speaker: Cifera
line: Does it even matter? You'll never guess whether I'm lying or telling the truth.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You're still wearing those golden boots I gave you.

speaker: Aglaea
line: I hope you're not running from someone the next time you wear them...

speaker: Cipher
line: Aglaea... did you see that?

speaker: Cipher
line: No one can catch up to me. I'm no longer running to escape anymore.

text: Pass through the chains and reach the highest point

speaker: Cipher
line: Deliverer! You'd better thank me —

speaker: Cipher
line: Every leisurely second you enjoy... was fought for by yours truly!

text: Prepare yourself and face the oncoming enemies

speaker: Cipher
line: *sigh* ...

speaker: Cipher
line: You just don't know when to quit, do you?

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Can't escape...

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: This... is fate...

speaker: Cipher
line: Fate? Hmph, I always thought only privileged city dwellers liked to toss that word around, as if they couldn't get by without using it as an excuse.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Cycles...

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Can't... be broken...

speaker: Cipher
line: ...Cycles, fate? Give me a break! Everyone has to walk their path! Those who cling to gods and prophecies end up as hollow shells of themselves.

speaker: Cipher
line: Back then, I was nothing but a scoundrel, a cheat, clawing and scrambling just to survive in this messed-up world. If I'd given up and played along...

speaker: Cipher
line: This place would've been nothing more than a lifeless wasteland by now.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Coreflame...

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: It has to be me...

speaker: Cipher
line: Ugh, my bad. Why bother offering wisdom to a mad dog who wouldn't understand it anyway?

speaker: Cipher
line: Do you know why I dragged you here, mutt? Word is, you've tangled with that golden-haired lion before.

speaker: Cipher
line: Looks like there's no getting away from you, and hey, that was a pretty good warm-up. Now...

speaker: Cipher
line: How about we spice things up with a bit of competition?

speaker: Cipher
line: As a fellow heir to the divine authority of Calamity , I've been a demigod for a thousand years longer than the little lion.

speaker: Cipher
line: Now, let me see if you're worth your title, Flame Reaver!

text: (Begin battle againstFlame Reaver of the Deepest Dark)

speaker: Cipher
line: I've been around for over a thousand years, and I've never met anyone who could match my speed... until now!

speaker: Cipher
line: But speed isn't my only trick. Today, you're getting the full performance!

text: (Single clone is defeated)

speaker: Cipher
line: Wrong target — looks like you need to work on your aim.

text: (Multiple clones defeated)

speaker: Cipher
line: I can summon as many clones as I need!

text: (Entering second phase)

speaker: Cipher
line: Hahaha! Good dog, is that all you've got?

speaker: Cipher
line: I guess your sword skills aren't as impressive as I thought!

text: (Flame Reaver reduced to 33% health)

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Resisting... is futile...

speaker: Cipher
line: I've played with you long enough...

speaker: Cipher
line: Time to retreat!

text: (Battle ends)
(Cutscene begins)

children.speaker: Cipher
children.line: Only a mindless fool... would fall for the same trick three times in a row.

text: (Cutscene ends)
A thousand years ago, at Dawncloud...

"The galaxy is vast beyond compare, containing an infinite number of possibilities." Our community needs more information on this page! Can you help out? Click here to add more. The reason provided was: Missing image

line: To all citizens of Okhema — today, I bring you two pieces of news: one sorrowful, one joyous.

speaker: "Atticus?"
line: First, let us offer our blessings to the departed. Our beloved Chaplain Phoros has returned to the embrace of Sky Father Kephale. May he rest in peace...

speaker: "Atticus?"
line: But citizens, do not grieve his passing! In his final moments, Chaplain Phoros found peace. While he still had his wits, he heard the final words of the sky father...

speaker: "Atticus?"
line: And that brings me to the joyous news I share with you today! Before the great Worldbearing Titan fell silent, they spoke one final message to my revered mentor. And now, I shall share those words with every soul in Amphoreus!

speaker: "Atticus?"
line: They said: "The prophecy has arrived. My mission is complete, and now I shall fall into eternal silence..."

speaker: "Atticus?"
line: "The eternal night is looming, the Dawn Device will safeguard the holy city, poised for the children of humanity to create miracles... forever! "

speaker: Grateful Citizen
line: Until... forever?

speaker: Excited Citizen
line: Sky father's love transcends time itself, stretching across endless eons!

speaker: "Atticus?"
line: Citizens, friends! As the newly appointed Chaplain, I propose we host a grand hundred-day celebration at Dawncloud, a feast in gratitude for the sky father's gift!

speaker: "Atticus?"
line: Our mission is to transform the sky father's words into unshakable faith. For a hundred dawns, through song and dance, every child of humanity within Amphoreus will come to believe —

speaker: Cipher
line: — The light of the Dawn Device never fades... Kephale's protection has no end!

speaker: Cipher
line: "You shall walk with greed, and die over petty change..."

speaker: Cipher
line: Ha, the prophecy's "petty change"...

speaker: Cipher
line: Was quite literal, after all...

speaker: Cipher
line: Atticus... He's a good kid...

speaker: Cipher
line: I stole your identity... I... owe you an apology...

speaker: Cipher
line: But I owe more than just an apology... There's also you, Agy...

speaker: Cipher
line: Back then, I... I had to leave Okhema...

speaker: Cipher
line: You see, you were so good at reading hearts... if I had stayed by your side...

speaker: Cipher
line: My fragile lies... would have been exposed sooner or later.

speaker: Cipher
line: Your weave shop... I wish... I could chance upon it again, just once...

speaker: Cipher
line: To be scolded by you and Tribbie...

speaker: Cipher
line: Ah... I'm sorry...

speaker: Cipher
line: In the end... I...

speaker: Cipher
line: I overestimated myself...

speaker: Cipher
line: "But... at least there's one thing... I did accomplish..."

speaker: Cipher
line: "Kephale's Coreflame is not here... It's safe... It's safe now..."

speaker: Cipher
line: "Even if I'm nothing more than a thief... I..."

speaker: Cipher
line: "...At least I did something for the Flame Chase..."

speaker: Cipher
line: "Agy... can you hear me?"

speaker: Cipher
line: "Say something... anything..."

speaker: Cipher
line: "Please..."

speaker: Aglaea
line: You are the unsung hero of Amphoreus, Cifera. You saved us all.

speaker: Aglaea
line: You betrayed the world...

speaker: Aglaea
line: ...and in exchange, you earned humanity a thousand more years of life.

text: (Cutscene begins)

children.speaker: Cipher
children.line: If there were a lie so brilliant that it could fool everyone...

children.speaker: Cipher
children.line: Wouldn't it simply become the truth?

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: Lies will always be lies, Cifera...

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: But sometimes... they can be more noble than the truth.

text: (Cutscene ends)
